title: Black Friday
description: Score amazing deals on the biggest shopping day of the year! Black Friday marks the official start of the holiday shopping season with incredible discounts, doorbuster sales, and limited-time offers. Whether you're shopping in-store or online, discover the best deals, learn shopping strategies, and find the perfect gifts for everyone on your list. Shop smart and save big!
howToCelebrate: Research deals and create a shopping list before heading out. Shop early for the best doorbuster deals, or stay home and shop online for convenience. Compare prices across different retailers to ensure you're getting the best deal. Set a budget and stick to it to avoid overspending. Consider shopping at small businesses on Small Business Saturday instead of just big retailers.
funFacts: Black Friday got its name because it's when retailers' books go from red (loss) to black (profit)
Over 165 million Americans shop on Black Friday weekend
The term 'Black Friday' was first used in 1961 in Philadelphia
Online Black Friday sales have grown by 20% annually since 2010
The average Black Friday shopper spends about $300

title: Cyber Monday
description: Shop from the comfort of your home on Cyber Monday! This online shopping extravaganza offers incredible deals on everything from electronics to clothing, making it the perfect day to complete your holiday shopping. Discover exclusive online discounts, learn about safe online shopping practices, and find the best deals without leaving your couch. Happy shopping!
howToCelebrate: Shop online from the comfort of your home for the best Cyber Monday deals. Sign up for retailer newsletters to get exclusive discount codes. Use price comparison tools to find the best deals across multiple websites. Take advantage of free shipping offers and extended return policies. Shop securely by using trusted websites and secure payment methods.
funFacts: Cyber Monday was created in 2005 by the National Retail Federation
It's the biggest online shopping day of the year in the United States
Cyber Monday sales have grown from $484 million in 2005 to over $10 billion today
The term was coined because people returned to work and shopped online on Monday
Mobile shopping accounts for over 50% of Cyber Monday traffic

title: National Small Business Saturday
description: Shop small and support local communities on National Small Business Saturday! This important shopping day encourages consumers to support small, local businesses in their communities. From family-owned restaurants to boutique stores, discover the unique products and personalized service that small businesses offer while helping to strengthen local economies.
howToCelebrate: Visit local small businesses in your community and make purchases. Share your favorite small businesses on social media to help promote them. Leave positive reviews for local businesses you love. Attend small business events or markets in your area. Consider starting your own small business or supporting a friend's entrepreneurial venture.
funFacts: Small Business Saturday was created by American Express in 2010
Small businesses create 2 out of every 3 new jobs in America
For every $100 spent at a local business, $68 stays in the community
Small businesses employ nearly half of all private sector employees
Small Business Saturday has generated over $120 billion in sales since its inception

title: Small Business Saturday
description: Support local entrepreneurs and shop small on Small Business Saturday! This special day encourages consumers to support small and local businesses in their communities. From unique boutiques to family restaurants, small businesses are the backbone of local economies and offer personalized service and unique products you won't find anywhere else.
howToCelebrate: Shop at local small businesses instead of big chain stores. Discover new restaurants, boutiques, and service providers in your area. Share photos and reviews of small businesses on social media to help them gain visibility. Buy gift cards from local businesses for holiday presents. Recommend your favorite small businesses to friends and family.
funFacts: Small Business Saturday was created by American Express in 2010
Small businesses employ nearly half of all American workers
For every $100 spent at a local business, $68 stays in the community
There are over 30 million small businesses in the United States
Small businesses create two-thirds of new jobs in America

title: National Shopping Day
description: Celebrate the joy of shopping and retail therapy on National Shopping Day! Whether you're hunting for bargains, treating yourself to something special, or finding the perfect gifts for loved ones, shopping can be both fun and rewarding. Discover new stores, support local businesses, and enjoy the experience of finding exactly what you're looking for.
howToCelebrate: Explore new shopping destinations and discover unique stores. Set a budget and treat yourself to something you've been wanting. Shop for holiday gifts early to avoid the rush. Compare prices and look for the best deals. Share your shopping finds and favorite stores on social media.
funFacts: The average American spends about $1,986 per year on shopping
Online shopping accounts for about 15% of total retail sales
Shopping can release endorphins and improve mood
The busiest shopping day of the year is typically the Saturday before Christmas
Window shopping became popular in the 19th century with the invention of plate glass

title: National Bargain Hunting Day
description: Hunt for the best deals and steals on National Bargain Hunting Day! There's nothing quite like the thrill of finding a great bargain or scoring an amazing deal. From clearance sales to coupon clipping, discover the art of smart shopping and learn how to stretch your dollar while still getting quality items you love.
howToCelebrate: Search for the best deals and discounts at your favorite stores. Use coupons and cashback apps to maximize savings. Compare prices across different retailers before making purchases. Visit outlet stores and clearance sections for great bargains. Share your best bargain finds and money-saving tips on social media.
funFacts: The word 'bargain' comes from the Old French 'bargaignier', meaning to haggle
Extreme couponing can save shoppers up to 90% on their purchases
End-of-season clearance sales often offer 50-70% discounts
Price comparison apps can help shoppers save an average of 20% per purchase
The best time to find bargains is typically at the end of each season

title: National Coupon Day
description: Save money and hunt for deals on National Coupon Day! Coupons are a smart shopper's best friend, helping stretch budgets and make purchases more affordable. From digital coupons to traditional paper clippings, discover the art of couponing and learn how to maximize your savings while still getting the products you love.
howToCelebrate: Collect and use coupons for your regular shopping trips. Download coupon apps and sign up for store loyalty programs. Organize your coupons for maximum efficiency and savings. Share coupon tips and deals with friends and family. Calculate how much money you save using coupons.
funFacts: The first coupon was created in 1887 for Coca-Cola
Americans redeem about 3 billion coupons annually
Digital coupons are growing faster than traditional paper coupons
The average coupon saves shoppers about $1.50
Extreme couponing can save up to 90% on grocery bills

title: National Retail Day
description: Celebrate the retail industry and the people who make shopping experiences great on National Retail Day! From friendly sales associates to innovative store designs, retail plays a vital role in our economy and daily lives. Appreciate the hard work of retail employees and the businesses that serve our communities.
howToCelebrate: Thank retail employees for their service and hard work. Shop at local retail businesses to support your community. Learn about the history and evolution of retail. Share positive reviews and experiences about your favorite stores. Appreciate the convenience and service that retail provides.
funFacts: The retail industry employs over 52 million people worldwide
Retail is one of the largest private sector employers
The first department store opened in Paris in 1838
Online retail accounts for about 15% of total retail sales
Customer service is the top factor in retail success

title: National Shop Local Day
description: Support your community on National Shop Local Day! Shopping locally keeps money in your community, supports local jobs, and helps small businesses thrive. From unique boutiques to family restaurants, local businesses offer personalized service and one-of-a-kind products that make communities special and vibrant.
howToCelebrate: Shop at local businesses instead of chain stores. Discover new local restaurants, shops, and services. Buy gifts from local artisans and craftspeople. Share photos and reviews of local businesses on social media. Encourage friends and family to support local businesses.
funFacts: For every $100 spent locally, $68 stays in the community
Local businesses employ 1 out of every 3 American workers
Small businesses are often more environmentally friendly than large chains
Local businesses donate 250% more to community causes than chains
Shopping locally helps preserve community character and uniqueness

title: National Online Shopping Day
description: Shop from the comfort of your home on National Online Shopping Day! E-commerce has revolutionized how we shop, offering convenience, variety, and often better deals than traditional retail. Discover new online stores, learn about safe shopping practices, and enjoy the ease of having everything delivered to your doorstep.

Online shopping can save time and reduce impulse purchases

title: National Gift Card Day
description: Give the gift of choice on National Gift Card Day! Gift cards are perfect presents that let recipients choose exactly what they want. From store-specific cards to general prepaid cards, discover the convenience and thoughtfulness of giving gift cards for any occasion.

title: National Mall Day
description: Shop till you drop on National Mall Day! Shopping malls are an iconic American invention that revolutionized retail and social life. From the first enclosed mall in 1956 to today's mega-malls, celebrate this uniquely American shopping experience that combines retail, entertainment, and community gathering spaces.

funFacts: The first enclosed shopping mall opened in 1956 in Edina, Minnesota
The Mall of America is the largest shopping mall in the United States
Shopping malls became popular in the 1960s and 70s
Malls often serve as community gathering places and event venues
The American shopping mall has influenced retail worldwide

title: National Garage Sale Day
description: Hunt for treasures on National Garage Sale Day! Garage sales are a uniquely American tradition that brings neighbors together and gives new life to old items. From early morning treasure hunting to haggling over prices, embrace the community spirit and environmental benefits of this beloved American shopping tradition.
howToCelebrate: Host your own garage sale to declutter and make money. Go garage sale hopping in your neighborhood. Look for unique finds and hidden treasures. Meet your neighbors and build community connections. Share your garage sale finds and tips on social media.

The average garage sale generates $200-500 in sales

description: The Tuesday before Thanksgiving reminds you to prepare for Black Friday shopping! National Shopping Reminder Day helps Americans get organized for the biggest shopping season of the year. Make your lists, plan your budget, and get ready for amazing deals.

funFacts: The average American spends over $1,000 on holiday shopping
Black Friday is one of the busiest shopping days of the year
Planning ahead can save shoppers 30-50% on purchases

description: Shop online without shipping fees on National Free Shipping Day! Typically in mid-December, this shopping holiday offers free shipping with guaranteed delivery before Christmas. It's perfect for last-minute shoppers who want to avoid shipping costs.

description: Score incredible post-holiday deals on National Clearance Day! After the holidays, retailers slash prices on seasonal merchandise, decorations, and gifts. Smart shoppers stock up for next year and grab deep discounts on quality items.

title: National Bargain Hunting Week

title: National Returns Day
description: The day after Christmas is unofficially National Returns Day! Return or exchange unwanted gifts, shop after-Christmas sales, and redeem gift cards. Retailers see massive returns and exchanges making this one of the busiest shopping days.
howToCelebrate: Return or exchange unwanted gifts (keep receipts!). Shop after-Christmas clearance sales. Use gift cards received for Christmas. Be patient and kind to retail workers. Take advantage of price adjustments on recent purchases.

title: Singles' Day
description: Shop the world's biggest online shopping day on Singles' Day! Originally from China, this global phenomenon has become the largest 24-hour shopping event worldwide, surpassing Black Friday and Cyber Monday combined. Retailers worldwide offer massive discounts on November 11th.

funFacts: Singles' Day generates over $100 billion in sales globally

Sales typically start at midnight and last 24 hours

description: Panic shop on Super Saturday! The last Saturday before Christmas is one of the busiest shopping days of the year. Last-minute shoppers flood stores and websites for final holiday purchases, and retailers offer desperate-to-sell discounts.

title: Restaurant Week

title: National Doughnut Day Deals
